Text:
The day I took a life for the first time after
becoming a member of the Shadow Garden...

Even when the mission was over, I couldn't forget the
sensation of my knife piercing their body or the
moment the glow of life left their eyes.
At night, I am plagued with nightmares.
"D-Don't kill me... I want to live..."
The swordsman's cries for mercy echo within my head.
I can see his blood-covered arm reaching toward me.
Stay away! Stay away! Don't drag me off with you!
And so, finally I am awoken by my own screams.
What...?!
Huff...huff... Not again...

My undergarments are drenched with sweat...
Disgusting.

*sigh* ...How often is this going to happen?
When will I...get used to it...?

Day after day after day... So many nightmares. I am
never going to get used to this...
Beta, did you have another nightmare?

When I look up, Lady Alpha is at my bedroom door,
a worried expression on her face.

I am concerned about you. If these sleepless nights
continue, you might get sick.

I am not trying to blame you, but as things are now I
won't be able to allow you to go on missions.
...I understand...

(What Lady Alpha says is true. The Cult of Diablos
are not easy opponents... I know that.)

(But is there any point to me being here...? A member
of the Shadow Garden that can't go on missions...)
I couldn't sleep for days, until one day...
Did you manage to sleep well last night?
Uh...yes.

You slept well, but you don't look very happy. What's
wrong?

Because I don't really know myself why I could sleep
so well last night...

You don't know...? You didn't do anything to make
yourself sleep?

Well, if you are going to force it out of me...
Master Shadow gave me some of his wisdom.
Wisdom...?

Yes. I think I was probably looking down in the dumps,
expecting another day with another nightmare. Then,
Master Shadow said, "Do you want some advice?"

I didn't know what kind of wisdom it would be...
But I definitely wanted to hear Master Shadow's
words if they could ease my heart's pain over
killing people.

But...he told me a story... One from long ago about
an old man and an old woman...

So the wisdom Shadow gave you, it was just a fairy
tale?

Yes, it was a fairy tale. I was just as baffled as
you are now, Lady Alpha.

I wasn't really sure... Can a fairy tale take away the
pain of killing?

But the fairy tale that Master Shadow recounted to
me was so interesting that time had passed before
I knew it...

I can't remember ever having such a good time before.
No...I think it might have been the first time I enjoyed
myself so much.

As I realized that, I fell into a deep sleep together
with those feelings.

And then, that night I didn't hear any voices. Those
voices...of the dead soldiers...condemning me...

I see...You may have gotten over the trauma, but I'm
relieved that you were able to sleep.

No...if it is from Shadow, then it must be something
special. I think he anticipated this result from the start.
Speaking of whom, here he is...
Hm...? What are you two talking about?

Nothing important. We just realized once again how
amazing you are. Nothing more.
Okaaay... Did I do something?

That's just like you, modest and without any
boasting.
What's up, Beta?

U-Um! Master Shadow! There is just one thing...I want
to ask, if it's okay?

This is the first time you've asked for something
from Shadow. Why not hear what she has to say?
Go ahead... If it's within my power, I'll do it.

I was wondering about how the story you told me last
night ends. The story about the girl who dropped her
glass slipper at a castle ball...

Oh yeah, you were so sleepy I promised to continue
the story another time, right?

I-If you can, how about tonight? Could you tell me
the rest of the story tonight? I've been wondering
about it since this morning...
I think I can manage that.
And the next day—

Lady Alpha! Lady Alpha! The fairy tale Master Shadow
told was so interesting.

It seems like you were up late again last night,
listening to Shadow's stories.

I was worried that I couldn't sleep until I heard the
story right until the end... I didn't mean for him to
spoil me.

I won't ever forget the excitement from when she
dropped her glass slipper to the end of the story.

And... Master Shadow promised to tell me more
stories!

Phew... It is almost like your recent depression
never happened. And...I never thought that you
would so actively pester Shadow.

That's true... Until recently I had thought of Master
Shadow as strong but a little scary.

If I can be honest, I still need to work up the
courage to talk to him...

But if fairy tales are involved, I want to hear more
and more. Now I want to be with him as much as
possible.

I wonder when I can listen to his stories again...
Lady Alpha! Do you think Master Shadow will be
around tonight?
Tonight...I wonder. Are you feeling that impatient?

Yes! I want to hear more and more stories from
Master Shadow!

U-Um, is it okay for me to go to the mansion?
To ask Master Shadow to come—
Beta, that's enough.

I decided to overlook some of your selfish behavior...
because I thought maybe his Shadow Wisdom could
ease your anxieties and help you find meaning in life.
My...selfish behavior?

He can't use his time just for you. You understand
that, right?
...I understand. I'll be more careful.
Good girl. I thought you would understand.
